category.name: Aptitude
category.description: Develop mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills for competitive exams and interviews.

sub_categories.name: Trigonometry
sub_categories.description: Master trigonometric functions, identities, and applications.

exercises.title: Advanced Trigonometric Identities
exercises.description: Work with complex trigonometric identities and proofs.

tasks.title: Double Angle Calculator
tasks.question:
Implement a double angle formula calculator.

Your calculator should:

  • Calculate sin(2θ), cos(2θ), tan(2θ)
  • Use double angle formulas
  • Verify identities numerically
  • Handle different forms of cos(2θ)
  • Provide step-by-step calculations
tasks.hint: Use formulas: sin(2θ) = 2sinθcosθ, cos(2θ) = cos²θ - sin²θ = 2cos²θ - 1 = 1 - 2sin²θ

tasks.title: Double Angle Formulas
tasks.question:
What is cos(2θ) in terms of cos θ only?

Consider: Different forms of the double angle formula
options: All of the above - equivalent forms

tasks.title: Sum and Difference Calculator
tasks.question:
Create a calculator for sum and difference formulas.

Your calculator should:

  • Calculate sin(A±B), cos(A±B), tan(A±B)
  • Use sum and difference formulas
  • Verify results numerically
  • Handle special cases
  • Provide formula applications
tasks.hint: Use formulas: sin(A+B) = sinAcosB + cosAsinB, cos(A+B) = cosAcosB - sinAsinB

exercises.title: Trigonometric Applications
exercises.description: Apply trigonometry to solve real-world problems.

tasks.title: Triangle Solver
tasks.question:
Implement a comprehensive triangle solver using trigonometry.

Your solver should:

  • Solve triangles given different combinations of sides/angles
  • Use Law of Sines and Law of Cosines
  • Handle ambiguous cases (SSA)
  • Calculate area using various formulas
  • Provide all missing sides and angles
tasks.hint: Use Law of Sines: a/sinA = b/sinB = c/sinC, Law of Cosines: c² = a² + b² - 2abcosC

tasks.title: Law of Sines
tasks.question:
When can the Law of Sines be used to solve a triangle?

Consider: What information is needed to apply the Law of Sines
tasks.hint: Think about the minimum information required
options: When you have two angles and one side - AAS or ASA
When you have three sides - SSS
When you have two sides and included angle - SAS

tasks.title: Vector Calculator
tasks.question:
Create a vector calculator using trigonometric functions.

Your calculator should:

  • Add and subtract vectors
  • Calculate vector magnitude and direction
  • Find dot product and cross product
  • Convert between polar and rectangular form
  • Handle 2D and 3D vectors
tasks.hint: Use magnitude = √(x² + y²), direction = tan⁻¹(y/x), dot product = |A||B|cosθ
